list.title: $3DTemporalExtension#temporalTilesetLoaded
list.description: Fills this.transactionsPerFeature map when the tileset has been loaded (all transactions are stored in the temporal extension part of the tileset).

list.title: $3DTemporalExtension#transactionsPerFeature
list.description: A map with feature IDs as keys and transactions of these features as value.

list.title: $3DTemporalExtension#transactionsPerTile
list.description: A map of map with transactions as values and organized per tiles and per features. This structure is used for optimizing the temporal culling (to decide which features should be displayed and with which style depending on the time, see TemporalProvider.js for more information). It is structured as follows: { tileId : featureID : { asSource: transaction; asDestination: transaction; } } Note that currently only the first transaction where the feature is a source or where the feature is a destination is kept. NORMALLY a feature shouldn't be the source (reps. the destination) of multiple transaction, since in this case one should create aggregates. Otherwise it might represent concurrent evolutions which are not managed in this implementation. However, in practical terms there is cases where a feature is the source (resp. destination) of multiple transactions. These cases might need to be investigated in more depth....

list.title: $3DTemporalExtension#updateTileExtensionModel
list.description: Triggered when the content of a tile has been loaded. Fills this.transactionsPerTile list with the transaction of this tile.

list.title: LinkProvider#_onCityObjectSelection
list.description: Triggers when a city object is selected. Updates the city object and its links in the provider, and refreshes the list of documents. The event is propagated.

list.title: LinkProvider#_onDisplayedDocumentChange
list.description: Triggers when the displayed document changed. Updates the displayed document reference in the link provider and re-applies the styles for the city objects. The event is propagated.

list.title: LinkProvider#_onFilteredDocumentsUpdate
list.description: Triggers when the filtered documents change. Updates the filtered document and their links in the provider, and re-applies the styles for the city objects. The event is propagated.

list.description: Stores city objects (CO) styles per tile and per date to avoid computing it multiple times. It's actually a map of a map and its structure is: { date: tile : styles[] } } where the position in the styles array is the id of the city object

list.title: TemporalProvider#changeTileState
list.description: Computes and applies the display state of a tile. This method is triggered by an event (TilesManager.EVENT_TILE_LOADED) indicating that a new tile content has been loaded (e.g. because it becomes visible by the camera)

list.title: TemporalProvider#changeVisibleTilesStates
list.description: Computes and applies the display state of currently visible tiles (i.e. those in the camera field of view and having features at the current display time). This method is triggered by the TemporalView when the time of the view is updated.

list.description: Computes and sets the style of the features of a given tile.

list.title: TemporalProvider#getTransactionStyleName
list.description: Generates the style name of a transaction. This method is recursive for aggregated transactions that may have multiple nested transactions. The style name correspond to the one created in the initCOStyles method).

list.title: TemporalProvider#initCOStyles
list.description: Initializes the styles affected to city objects to represent transactions (see 3DTiles_temporal extension for more information on transactions). The names of the styles match transaction names, except for 'noTransaction' dans 'hide'.

list.description: Sets the style of a given city object in the tiles manager if this style has been registered in the tiles manager (e.g. in this.initCOStyles()).

list.description: Searches for a HTML node that can contains the extension.

list.description: The inner HTML content for the extension. If this is a button, it represents the displayed text. If this is a div, it represents the inner HTML content.

list.title: WindowExtension#id

list.title: WindowExtension#label
list.description: The unique label for the extension.

list.title: WindowExtension#oncreated
list.description: A callback triggered when the HTML elements of the extension is effectively created.

list.title: getBatchIdFromIntersection
list.description: Gets an object batch ID from an intersection. This methods takes one of the 3 points of the intersection triangle and retrieves the corresponding batch ID in the intersection tile.

list.title: getBatchTableFromTile
list.description: Search a batch table in a tile. A tile is a THREE.js 3DObject with a 3-level hierarchy : Object3D > Scene > Mesh. This function searches into the for the batch table (which is located in the Object3D level).

list.title: getBuildingIdFromIntersection
list.description: Gets a building ID from an intersection. The intersecting object must be a "Mesh" object with a batch id.

list.title: getFirstTileIntersection
list.description: Get the first intersection object where the target is a 3D object with a batch id (a.k.a. the "Mesh" of a tile).

list.title: getMeshesFromTile
list.description: Returns all the THREE.js meshes in the tile

list.title: getTileFromMesh
list.description: Returns the tile in which a mesh is contained

list.title: getTileInLayer
list.description: Find the tile in the 3DTiles layer with the specifid ID.

list.title: getTileInTileset
list.description: Finds the tile in the tileset with the specific ID.

list.title: getTilesInfo
list.description: Creates a Tiles Info (TI) object from a 3DTiles Layer. The TI is an object containing associations between tile, batch IDs and data specific to the batched geometry (vertex indexes, centroid, properties from the batch table).

list.title: getVerticesCentroid
list.description: Computes and returns the centroid of the vertices given as parameter.

list.title: getVisibleTileCount
list.description: Counts the number of 3DTiles tiles displayed by the view.

list.title: getVisibleTiles
list.description: Retrieve all visible 3DTiles visible tiles (ie. those that are currently rendered in the scene). This function recursively explores the tileset to find all tiles and return them in a flattened array.
